itunes:subtitle: Ross Patterson and Dan Hollaway are joined by New York Times bestselling sports psychology journalist David Epstein to discuss the science behind athletes choking, why Tom Brady is still succeeding at such a high level, the story behind his breaking of t...
itunes:summary:
Ross Patterson and Dan Hollaway are joined by New York Times bestselling sports psychology journalist David Epstein to discuss the science behind athletes choking, why Tom Brady is still succeeding at such a high level, the story behind his breaking of the news that A-Rod was on steroids, how athletes age and the misconceptions behind how they age, and how sports teams struggle to turn data into on-field results.

description:
Ross Patterson and Dan Hollaway are joined by New York Times bestselling sports psychology journalist David Epstein to discuss the science behind athletes choking, why Tom Brady is still succeeding at such a high level, the story behind his breaking of the news that A-Rod was on steroids, how athletes age and the misconceptions behind how they age, and how sports teams struggle to turn data into on-field results.
